Package bturnert_a3.ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
bturnert_a3.ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
This Class hold the function for manipulation of Investment items in an ArrayList.

Contains the main class for execution of the program.

      public static boolean investmentsIsEmpty()
      Checks if the Investments ArrayList is empty or not, returning a boolean value representing if the list is empty or not.
      Returns:
      Returns either true if the ArrayList is empty or false if it is not empty.

    • inInvestments

      private static int inInvestments()
      Iterates through all Investment objects in the InvestmentList ArrayList. Checks if the symbol matches symbol in the current Investment object. Returning the position in the ArrayList if found.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer representing either -1 if the symbol is not found in any of the Investment objects, or if found in the ArrayList indicating the position in the InvestmentList ArrayList where the symbol was matched.

    • searchWord

      private static String searchWord​(String searchWord)
      Takes a string and returns a lowercase copy with all leading and trailing white space removed.
      Parameters:
      searchWord - String representing the Word passed to the function that must be updated before proceeding.
      Returns:
      Returns a String representing the line that was read.

    • separate

      private static String[] separate​(String enteredString)
      Splits the keywords string into sepaerate words and returns them as an array of strings.
      Parameters:
      enteredString - String passed to method representing the key words to search for.
      Returns:
      Reurns an array of strings representing the enteredString after parsing it wherever there is a space.

    • showKeyword

      private static boolean showKeyword​(String[] keys, String currentName)
      Decides if it is okay to display an investment based on the keywords matching.
      Parameters:
      keys - String array passed to method representing the enteredString after parsing it wherever there is a space.
      currentName - String representing the name of the current investment.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value representing okay to display investment or not; true = okay, flase = not.

    • validRange

      private static int validRange​(String enteredRange)
      Checks if the entered range for search function is valid.
      Parameters:
      enteredRange - String passed to method representing the range for the search method entered by the user.
      Returns:
      Returns a value in the range 0-5, where the value returned indicates the specific case. 0 = invalid, 1 = no range, 2 = specific price, 3 = specific price or higher, 4 = specific price or lower, 5 = price range.

    • showRange

      private static boolean showRange​(double min, double max, double specificPrice, int rangeType, double currentPrice)
      Takes in all parameters relating to search price range and computes wether or not it is okay to display the investment based on the price range matching.
      Parameters:
      min - Double representing the minimum value that price can be to match in the even the entered range was specific price or higher, or full price range. -1 if not set.
      max - Double representing the maxmum value that price can be to match in the event the entered range was specific price or lower, or full price range. -1 if not set.
      specificPrice - Double representing the value that price must match in the event the entered range was specific price. -1 if not set.
      rangeType - Integer representing the value in the range 0-5, where the value indicates the specific case. 0 = invalid, 1 = no range, 2 = specific price, 3 = specific price or higher, 4 = specific price or lower, 5 = price range.
      currentPrice - Double representing the price of the current investment.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean represetning if it is okay to display investment or not; true = okay, false = not.

    • addToHashMap

      private static void addToHashMap​(String currentName, Integer index)
      Adds an element or updates an exisitng element in the HashMap.
      Parameters:
      currentName - String representing the name of the current Investment.
      index - Integer representing the position in the ArrayList.

    • removeFromHashMap

      private static void removeFromHashMap​(String currentName, Integer index)
      Removes elements form the HashMap when they are completely sold off.
      Parameters:
      currentName - String representing the name of the current Investment.
      index - Integer representing the position in the ArrayList.

    • searchUsingHashMap

      private static void searchUsingHashMap​(String searchWord, String searchSymbol, int rangeType, double min, double max, double specificPrice)
      Searches for element in ArrayList using HashMap.
      Parameters:
      searchWord - String representing the specified search words.
      searchSymbol - String representing the specified search symbol.
      rangeType - Integer representing the type of seach Price range was inputed.
      min - Double representing the minimum value the price range must be to match.
      max - Double representing the maximim value the price range can be to match.
      specificPrice - Double representing the specific price that must be match.

    • buy

      public static int buy​(int investmentType, String tempName, int tempQuantity, double tempPrice)
      Creates Stock and MutualFund objects and adds them to the associated ArrayList.

      Alternatively increases the varaibles in pre-existing Stock and MutualFund objects found in their associated ArrayLists.

      Parameters:
      investmentType - Intefer representing the type of investment to be created, 1 = Stock, 2 = MutualFund.
      tempName - String representing the name of the investment.
      tempQuantity - Integer representing the quantity of the investment.
      tempPrice - Double representing the price of the investment.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer representing the outcome of the buy operation, 0 = failed, 1 = successful new investment, 2 = successful existing investment.

    • sell

      public static int sell​(int tempQuantity, double tempPrice)
      Deletes pre-existing Stock and MutualFund objects form their associated ArrayLists.

      Alternatively lowers the variables in pre-existing Stock and MutualFund objects found in the associated ArrayList.

      Parameters:
      tempQuantity - Integer representing the quantity of the investment to sell.
      tempPrice - Double representing the price to sell the investment at.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer representing the outcome of the sell operation, 0 = no investments avaiable to sell, 1 = specified investment does not exist, 2 = cannot sell more than is owned, 3 = sold all of investment, 4 = sold part of investment, -1 = i dont know what went wrong.

    • update

      public static int update​(int index, Double tempPrice)
      Updates the Price associated with pre-existing Stock and MutualFund objects found in the associated ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      index - Integer representing the currently selected investment in the ArrayList.
      tempPrice - Double representing the new price of the investment at index.
      Returns:
      Returns and integer representing the outcome of the update operation, 0 = nothing to update, 1 = updated Stock successfully, 2 = updated MutualFund successfully.

    • getGain

      public static void getGain​(int index)
      Outputs the theoretical gain that could be obtained by the user if they completely sold all Stock and MutualFund investments in their portfolio at their current prices.
      Parameters:
      index - Integer representing the currently selected investment in the ArrayList.

    • search

      public static boolean search​(int index, String tempSymbol, String tempKey, String tempRange)
      Searches the Stock and MutualFund Arraylists for specific objects based on three search paramiters. Paramiters are as follows: 1) symbol 2) key words 3) a price range. Prints all objects that meet search requirements and does not print those that do not.
      Parameters:
      index - Integer representing the index of the current Investment in the ArrayList.
      tempSymbol - String representing the symbol to seach for.
      tempKey - String representing the key words to search for.
      tempRange - String representing the price range to search for.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value representing if the current element should be printed based off the search critereia.

    • readFromFile

      private static void readFromFile​(String[] args)
      Attempts to read from a file specified as the first command line param.
      Parameters:
      args - String array representing the command line arguments.

    • writeToFile

      public static void writeToFile()
      Writes to a file specified as the first command line param or if none was specified creating a new file.

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      Runs the ePortfolio program until such a time as the exit condition is entered.
      Parameters:
      args - String array representing the command line arguments.
